intro: Doellingeria komonoensis, commonly known as the Komono rush, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in late summer. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native habitat.
